citation.article-title: Alicyclobacillus hesperidum sp. nov. and a related genomic species from solfataric soils of Sao Miguel in the Azores.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Alicyclobacillus hesperidum sp. nov.

Alicyclobacillus hesperidum (hes.pe.ri'dum. L. fem. plur. N. hesperidum of the Hesperides, mythological figures whom the Greeks believed to have lived at the Western edge of the Earth in a miraculous garden, which we interpret as the Azores)
Rod-shaped cells that are 2.1-3.9 μm long and 0.5-0.7 μm wide.
Gram stain is positive.
Cells are nonmotile and terminal spores are formed; sporangia are not swollen.
Colonies on BAM medium are 1-2 mm in diameter after 72 h of growth and are not pigmented.
Growth occurs above 35 °C and below 60 °C; the optimum growth temperature for strains FR-11T and FR-1b is 50-53 °C.
The optimum pH is 3.5-4.0; growth does not occur at pH 2.0 or pH 6.0.
Strains are cytochrome oxidase-negative and catalase is weak or negative.
Yeast extract or growth factors are not required for growth.
The major fatty acids are ω-cyclohexyl C17:0 and ω-cyclohexyl C19:0; branchedchain fatty acids are also present in large proportions.
Strains do not reduce nitrate to nitrite.
Gelatin, hide powder and starch are hydrolysed, but elastin and fibrin are not.
Strains FR-11T and FR-1b utilize many hexoses and disaccharides, but pentoses and polyols, with the exception of mannitol and glycerol, are not utilized as single carbon sources.
L-Serine, L-asparagine, L-glutamate, L-glutamine, L-proline and L-arginine are not utilized as single carbon sources.
Acid is produced from virtually the same sugars that are utilized as single carbon sources.
The DNA of strain FR-11T has a G­+C content of 53.3 mol%.
This bacterium was isolated from solfataric soils in the Furnas area of the Island of São Miguel, the Azores.
Strain FR-11T has been deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen, Braunschweig, Germany as strain DSM12489T.
Strain FR-1b (=DSM 12766) is an additional strain of this species.
